content.description: It starts further to the left of Shokunin and Kyoto on a small edge down low. You will have to scrunch yourself up for this sit-start. Throw up to a bigger ledge and then top out directly above that.
content.location: To the left of Kyoto, the side of Stone Soup closest to the river.

content.description: Sit start on low crimps and work the edges and crimps to the top out.
content.location: Directly behind the Stone Soup boulder on a similar but smaller boulder. Sit starts on some low crimps and then works the edges and crimps straight up to the top.

content.description: On the far right of the face of Stone Soup. Start low on a well-chalked and decent flake then make a large move up with your right hand to a bad circle-shaped crimp. Get your left foot up to the flake and then slowly bring your left hand up to a bad crimp pocket above your head. Move your right hand to the next closest pocket and slap over the top after bringing your feet up. Mantle or flop like a whale for the top out.
content.location: On the far right of the Stone Soup boulder, closest to the trail, the river is visible from this side of the boulder as well.

content.description: Start close to the start of Shokunin on the good flake to the left of it. Move out left to a thin and sharp, but good crimp. Bring your right hand up to a crimp pinch and then move left into another flake to top out.
content.location: To the left of Shokunin on the Stone Soup Boulder. The side facing the river, starts on a low flake that should be chalked.

content.description: Start to the left of Matsutake standing up. Use the big undercling to get your feet situated then move up to a large edge. Top out above that.
content.location: To the left of Matsutake and Kyoto close to the edge of the boulder. On the side of Stone Soup facing the river. Starts on an obvious undercling feature.

content.description: A medium-sized boulder very near to a louder section of the river. It makes for rather peaceful climbing. A mix of hard and moderately graded routes.
